name: Tezcatepetonco Range
desc: Living with the Iktomisaurs, this is where the Masters of the Night-Wind, most mysterious of the six major tribes of Natlan, call home. It is said that at night, the members of the tribe and their Saurians use glowing patterns to listen to the echoes of the silent kingdom of the night.

customize.name: Glowing Hornshroom
customize.desc: A fungus that emits a faint light in the darkness. It is so named because its shape resembles the horny crest of an Iktomisaurus.

customize.name: Sprayfeather Gill
customize.desc: A special feather-shaped species of plant that grows by the seaside. It looks kind of like a seagrass but is in truth a soft-bodied aquatic coral with a unique shape.

customize.name: Recipe: Grainfruit Wrap
customize.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Grainfruit Wrap.

customize.name: Recipe: Volcano Cake
customize.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Volcano Cake.

customize.name: Recipe: Mystique Soup
customize.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Mystique Soup.

customize.name: Talisman of the Enigmatic Land
customize.desc:
A talisman that somehow appeared in your inventory after you passed the Wayward Hermetic Spiritspeaker's test.
In some records kept by the Masters of the Night-Wind, priests masterful in Spiritspeaking can use meditation to pass their consciousness through the light and shadow that reflects off obsidian, thus reaching the enigmatic underground realm that only the dead may enter. This deed is, however, perilous, and priests who perform it must often wear such talismans to guard their souls from being lost in that mysterious land. However, this talisman's symbolic value far outstrips its real effects. Perhaps the hermit-priest who grants this to a warrior who passes the test only does so as a simple blessing.

customize.name: Eroded Scale-Feather
customize.desc:
A pitch-black scale that fell to the ground after the battle against the Lord of Eroded Primal Fire.
The ancient dragons once used their fallen scales as a means to transmit secret messages and edicts.
This scale has been utterly corroded by the power of darkness, the light that was once engraved upon it wholly devoured, leaving naught but twisted, dark remnants.

customize.name: Eroded Sunfire
customize.desc:
Though the battle with the Lord of Eroded Primal Fire has ended, this ring-shaped flame yet burns.
In the beginning, in the deepest, darkest of nights, the master of flame emulated the sun, thus supplanting the light of the starry skies.
Though the flame's glow has been halfway corroded, it still reflects the world of old in its glory.

customize.name: Eroded Horn
customize.desc:
The Lord of Eroded Primal Fire's blazing horn, cut off in the heat of battle.
Legend has it that the original primal flame was the birthplace of light and wisdom, and the horn of the Pyro Dragon shone like a pillar of fire, illuminating the savage, desolate world.
And though the base of the flaming horn has been corroded, the light that once illuminated the world remains without blemish.

customize.name: Purple Obsidian Fragment
customize.desc: An obsidian fragment with engraved patterns styled like those of the Masters of the Night-Wind, which you obtained by chance while exploring. It appears that you could form a full ring using three of them, though what that will achieve, you cannot tell.

customize.name: Purple Obsidian Ring
customize.desc: An obsidian ring with engraved patterns styled like those of the Masters of the Night-Wind. It is an ancient medium by which the tribe established contact with the deep night. Perhaps its strength can allow you to cross the boundary between this place and a certain other location...

customize.name: Radiant Spincrystal 143
customize.desc: This wondrous crystal contains a certain rhythm, like something beautiful woven from delicate silk. These items can be found throughout the mainland or from merchants who collect curios. The tune held within this crystal can be revivified in your Serenitea Pot using either "Euphonium Unbound: Winding" or "Euphonium Unbound: Soaring." The tune contained within this Radiant Spincrystal is a mysterious melody from Natlan.

customize.name: Radiant Spincrystal 144
customize.desc: This wondrous crystal contains a certain rhythm, like something beautiful woven from delicate silk. These items can be found throughout the mainland or from merchants who collect curios. The tune held within this crystal can be revivified in your Serenitea Pot using either "Euphonium Unbound: Winding" or "Euphonium Unbound: Soaring." The tune contained within this Radiant Spincrystal is a mysterious melody from Natlan.

customize.name: Radiant Spincrystal 145
customize.desc: This wondrous crystal contains a certain rhythm, like something beautiful woven from delicate silk. These items can be found throughout the mainland or from merchants who collect curios. The tune held within this crystal can be revivified in your Serenitea Pot using either "Euphonium Unbound: Winding" or "Euphonium Unbound: Soaring." The tune contained within this Radiant Spincrystal is a mysterious melody from Natlan.

customize.name: Radiant Spincrystal 146
customize.desc: This wondrous crystal contains a certain rhythm, like something beautiful woven from delicate silk. These items can be found throughout the mainland or from merchants who collect curios. The tune held within this crystal can be revivified in your Serenitea Pot using either "Euphonium Unbound: Winding" or "Euphonium Unbound: Soaring." The tune contained within this Radiant Spincrystal is a mysterious melody from Natlan.

customize.name: Radiant Spincrystal 147
customize.desc: This wondrous crystal contains a certain rhythm, like something beautiful woven from delicate silk. These items can be found throughout the mainland or from merchants who collect curios. The tune held within this crystal can be revivified in your Serenitea Pot using either "Euphonium Unbound: Winding" or "Euphonium Unbound: Soaring." The tune contained within this Radiant Spincrystal is a mysterious melody from Natlan.

customize.name: Lord of Eroded Primal Fire
customize.desc:
A fell dragon, congealed from the power of pitch-black darkness.

A monster of the void, known as both the Reaper of the Abyss and "Gosoythoth." It is able to corrupt memories contained within the ley lines of the earth, congealing them into tangible forces of catastrophic portent. From these memories that since time immemorial have flowed below the land, it has managed to extract the remnant will of a primordial elemental dragon sovereign, drawing it out like marrow to repurpose as the foundation of its own fabricated image.

But is it truly a mere "image"? Brought back by the very otherworldly forces it had once resisted, a once-dead dragon opens its eyes anew, forsaking all in this brief dream of a resurrection. Trapped perpetually in the final day of its existence by this pitch-black gospel, its boundless fury has consumed all reason. Now, what remains is its unrelenting lust for battle, burning on without end.

customize.name: Wayward Hermetic Spiritspeaker
customize.desc: A priestess of the Masters of the Night-Wind who has lived apart from her tribe, honing her abilities in utter solitude. It is said that her Spiritspeaking powers surpass those of ordinary priests and shamans, a result of having had the protection of the Masters of the Night-Wind's Wayob bestowed upon her. Both a blessing and a curse, these powers were at first beyond her ability to control, which was why she set out to master them in isolation from her tribe. Though she has since done so, to this day she still lives in seclusion, a habit that has earned her a reputation as a loner and a recluse. Rumor has it, however, that she is more than willing to teach those who seek her guidance â€” though always on her own terms...

customize.name: Iktomisaurus Chick
customize.desc:
A young Iktomisaur with a keen sense of perception.
It has yet to grow its full plumage and may even appear a little slow on the uptake. It is said that among the Saurians that now live, Iktomisaurs not only have the longest lifespans, but spend the longest time as juveniles too. They possess the capacity to communicate with the Night Kingdom or Wayob, though it may take many years before the young Saurians can fully comprehend this.

customize.name: Iktomisaurus
customize.desc:
Able to use their plumage for leaping, Iktomisaurs are also the only type of Saurian to have grasped how to enter the "Spiritspeaker" state.
According to legend, their ancestors did not have a physical form, and instead could drift like spirits between reality and the spiritual realm, manifesting themselves through the darkness of night. Some also say that the first Iktomisaur to emerge from the Night Kingdom was not actually a true Saurian, but rather a unique race distinct from ordinary Saurians.

customize.name: Spiritspeaker Warrior: Determinator
customize.desc:
A warrior from the Night-Wind, and a tribal guardian that patrols the misty canyons.
To a certain degree, they can draw upon the power of their body paint to wield their weapons with their willpower.

customize.name: Spiritspeaker Warrior: Psychokinetic
customize.desc:
A warrior from the Night-Wind, and a tribal guardian that patrols the misty canyons.
It is said that their body paint is an art that evolved from the practice of Phlogiston Engraving, and that it takes long years of training to fully master the power contained within.

customize.name: Spiritspeaker Warrior: Contemplator
customize.desc:
A warrior from the Night-Wind, and a tribal guardian that patrols the misty canyons.
Only sentries whose strength has been tested are permitted to daub themselves with such body paint, infused as it is with mysterious powers. This also signifies that these warriors have reached a new phase in their mental training.

customize.name: Iktomisaurus Warrior: Icy Tidebearer
customize.desc:
A powerful warrior from the Night-Wind, whose bravery has been acknowledged and for which they may wear the Saurian Crown.
Tribal warriors from the Masters of the Night-Wind do not typically excel when it comes to conventional strength. Their ability to manipulate weapons with ease comes instead from years of mental training. Thus, compared to combat prowess in itself, warriors from the Masters of the Night-Wind place greater value on the gift of "Spiritspeaking." Drawing upon the power of special graffiti and willpower alone, it is said that the most exceptional of Spiritspeakers can lift boulders as tall as people.

customize.name: Iktomisaurus Warrior: Cryocrystal Cannon
customize.desc:
A powerful warrior from the Night-Wind, whose bravery has been acknowledged and for which they may wear the Saurian Crown.
Without exception, it is said that tribal warriors who win the acknowledgment of the Iktomisaurs must possess extraordinarily keen senses and formidable mental strength. They can even use their power to make slight alterations to the trajectory of the projectiles that they fire from their cannons.

customize.name: Biting-Cold Wayob Manifestation
customize.desc:
The Masters of the Night-Wind believe in and worship the Wayob, which manifests upon the land with the power of totems and Nightsouls.
The Masters of the Night-Wind have tried using many mediums to communicate with the Night Kingdom. Eventually, they discovered that the medium that allowed them to establish the most stable connection with the Wayob was obsidian. This may explain why, over the ages, Wayob Manifestations have taken on a form that resembles a stone statue. The Masters of the Night-Wind believe their Wayob has the power to control the process of freezing and crystallization, and can also command both fixedness and mutability.

customize.name: Cacaua Goat
customize.desc:
These gentle beasts can be found all over Teyvat and were among the earliest to be domesticated by humans.
Contrary to what the name might suggest, Cacaua Goats do not give off a uniquely bitter odor. This unforgettable name originates from the hue of their wool, which closely resembles that of food and drink made from Cacahuatl. For traditional Natlan dyers, achieving a chocolate or xocoatl color is not an easy task, as the slightest mistake might result in a dirty-looking finish like rain-soaked mud. The wool of these robustly-built Cacaua Goats has a smooth texture and a clean, chocolatey tone, which is why they are so highly valued...

customize.name: Capybara
customize.desc:
These herbivores, which often dwell close to the water, are famous for their steely, stoic "won't even twitch if lightning strikes right next to their toes" disposition. Tourists consider them to be the paragon of animal friends.
Capybaras like to zone out while having a soak in the water, or sun themselves on the shore, and it's quite common for them to barely move for most of the day, as though not a single thing in the world could possibly perturb their calm demeanor and make them anxious. Despite their fluffy appearance, their hairs are actually quite hard and tough. If you pet them in the same direction as their coat of hair, it feels relatively smooth, but should you pet them in the opposite direction, you may end up with a scratched hand. Perhaps that is the reason even famished predators do not regard these completely harmless and quite defenseless little friends as prey...

customize.name: Flammabomb Wood
customize.desc:
Timber obtained from Flammabomb trees. Unlike what their names suggest, such timber is resistant to catching fire or exploding once processed using methods recommended by the Collective of Plenty.

Can be used to create furnishings.

customize.name: White Chestnut Oak Wood
customize.desc:
Timber obtained from White Chestnut Oak Trees. It strikes a balance between hardness and toughness, making it easy to process. Though it appears no different from most other wood, its color grows lighter once processed using methods common to the tribes of Natlan, becoming nearly white, hence the name.

Can be used to create furnishings.

customize.name: Amazolli
customize.desc: The owner of the "Idukan's Trove."

customize.name: Biram
customize.desc: Chief of the Masters of the Night-Wind.

imgDesc.text: Living with the Iktomisaurs, this is where the Masters of the Night-Wind, most mysterious of the six major tribes of Natlan, call home. It is said that at night, the members of the tribe and their Saurians use glowing patterns to listen to the echoes of the silent kingdom of the night.

Maintaining graffiti on such a large scale requires hard work by generation after generation. It is said that once someone sleeping under the giant graffiti dreamt of a gargantuan bird spreading its wings.

galleryCharacter.key: Ceremonial Site Lost in Night's Dim Light

imgDesc.text: After passing the test, those members of the Masters of the Night-Wind who are considered to be Spiritspeakers train here from a very young age, learning how to correctly interpret the words of the Nightsouls.

The floating isles, at one time shrouded in dense fog, were once sacrificial sites on the heights that towered over the land. Ultimately, however, they had to be sunk into the waters to seal away the evil that had seduced the masses.
"The great priest placed the mirror on the ground, forming the cliff walls here, to hold back the black tide."
